reference.title: Why use JMS?
reference.shortdesc: JMS is the messaging standard that is used to send and receive messages from queues. This process enables distributed communication with external systems in a loosely coupled, reliable, and asynchronous manner.

section.p: There are benefits to using JMS as the API to write an ready applications. Some advantages derive from JMS being an open standard with multiple implementations. Using an open standard provides the following benefits:

ul.li: The protection of investment, both in skills and application code.
The availability of people skilled in JMS application programming
The ability to plug in different JMS implementations to fit different requirements.

section.p: The JMS application is written to use references to the interfaces in javax.jms package.
